page.title: 03JOBS OR NO JOBS
page.content: Most people are either unemployed and looking for work or retired.Some have jobs in the local I.C.I., in B.S.C. Redcar,with the Electricity Board and at a nearby Power Station.Most workers are manual,few people were professional.There is no obvious work for women apart from part-time jobs such as cleaners and bar-maids. Prospects for school-leavers are grim with fewer openings for the young in B.S.C. and I.C.I.Most people feel strongly about unemployment and expressed the views that the situation was deteriorating for young and old and it is the governments business to do something about it.Some were optimistic in believing that jobs will come in time.There was no evidence of "cottage industries" springing up as a response to unemployment except for some small trade in allotment produce.
